p: EOs could also be applied as inhalation-based treatment, which could signify a natural way to heal one’s mind, body, and soul [ 265]. In Bagci et al.’s study [ 153], it was investigated whether inhalation of the Anthriscus nemorosa EO leads to behavioural changes that indicated significant memory improvement and exhibited both anxiolytic- and antidepressant-like effects in dual-treated rats. The results suggested that A. nemorosa EO inhalation can prevent scopolamine-induced memory impairment, anxiety, and depression [ 153].
